word: You must not lift and carry any more burdens than you are now bearing.  You should be laying off instead of increasing objects for which you will be solicitous. We are both descending the hill of life. Your hair is already white. Mine is growing gray fast. Our physical powers are weakening. Our mental powers will be enfeebled, I fear, with the physical.--Letter 49, 1876, p. 5. (To James White, April, 1876.)
